passage_text: LINK / CITE ADD TO WORD LIST. verb. The definition of beleaguer means to harass with several issues. An example of beleaguer is to cause stress to an ex wife by threatening to not pay child support unless she agrees to several demands.
: to cause constant or repeated trouble for (a person, business, etc.).

1 It was beleaguered by the Portuguese in 1660, and in 1705 by the Allies in the War of the Spanish Succession. 2  The negotiations having failed, he marched to relieve the beleaguered garrison of Adigrat; but Menelek, discouraged by the heavy losses at Adowa, broke up his camp and returned southwards Abyssinto Shoa.
